fscLVM’s documentation¶

Tutorial¶

# BLA

## BKWJ EDJ

`python print("ola") `

BLA SECTION¶

fscLVM.initFA(Y, terms, I, annotation='MSigDB', nHidden=3, nHiddenSparse=0, pruneGenes=False, FPR=0.99, FNR=0.001, noise='gauss', minGenes=20)[source]¶

Association between genetic markers and phenotype for continuous traits.

Matrix X shall contain the genetic markers (e.g., number of minor alleles) with rows and columns representing samples and genetic markers, respectively. The user must specify only one of the parameters G and K for defining the genetic background. Let \(N\) be the sample size, \(S\) the number of covariates, \(P_c\) the number of genetic markers to be tested, and \(P_b\) the number of genetic markers used for Kinship estimation.

Parameters:
  • Y (array_like) – Phenotype described by the number of successes, as non-negative integers. Dimension (\(N\times 0\)).
  • ntrials (array_like) – Phenotype described by the number of trials, as positive integers. Dimension (\(N\times 0\)).
  • X (array_like) – Candidate genetic markers (or any other type of explanatory variable) whose association with the phenotype will be tested. Dimension (\(N\times P_c\)).
  • G (array_like) – Genetic markers matrix used internally for kinship estimation. Dimension (\(N\times P_b\)).
  • K (array_like) – Kinship matrix. Dimension (\(N\times N\)).
  • covariates (array_like) – Covariates. Default is an offset. Dimension (\(N\times S\)).
  • progress (bool) – Shows progress. Defaults to True.
Returns:

A lim.genetics.qtl.LikelihoodRatioTest instance.

bla
